episodes.title: Melinda Gates Breaks Silence on Bill Gates' Mention in Epstein Files | Firstpost America | N18G
episodes.description:
Melinda Gates Breaks Silence on Bill Gates' Mention in Epstein Files

Melinda French Gates has reacted after renewed attention on Jeffrey Epstein-linked documents again placed her former husband, Bill Gates, under scrutiny. Epstein, a US financier and convicted sex offender, maintained ties with powerful figures even after his 2008 conviction and died in jail in 2019. Bill Gates has acknowledged meeting Epstein, calling it a “mistake,” and has denied any wrongdoing. In recent remarks, Melinda French Gates said the resurfacing details are personally painful and revive difficult memories from their nearly three-decade-long marriage. She drew a clear line, saying unanswered questions about Epstein and Gates’ past associations are for him to address. The Gates divorced in 2021 after 27 years, with Melinda previously indicating Epstein-related concerns contributed to the breakdown of the marriage.

episodes.title: US: DoJ’s Release of Latest Epstein Files Show Trump’s Private Jet Travels | Firstpost America
episodes.description:
The US Department of Justice on Tuesday released more than 30,000 additional documents tied to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, marking the largest disclosure so far. Many files are heavily redacted, but the latest batch draws attention for increased references to President Donald Trump, including an internal prosecutor email citing flight records that appear to contradict Trump’s past denials of traveling on Epstein’s plane. The documents also include unverified and disputed allegations, which the Justice Department warns may be unfounded or sensationalist. Officials stressed that being named in the files does not imply guilt, even as scrutiny intensifies.

---

episodes.title: Epstein Seen Hugging, Kissing Young Girls, As DOJ Removes Trump Images | Firstpost America | N18G
episodes.description:
Newly released US Justice Department documents have reignited scrutiny of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, following the publication of previously unseen photographs. The images, with children’s identities obscured, show Epstein in close proximity to very young children and have raised fresh concerns about how long alleged abuses went unchecked. Officials say the children appear younger than those referenced in Epstein’s 2008 plea deal, though no identities or victim status have been confirmed. The release follows claims that early warnings to authorities were ignored. Some files were briefly removed for review, including images of President Donald Trump, drawing political criticism. Overall, the disclosure underscores lingering questions that remain.

episodes.title: Epstein Files LIVE: Gloria Allred, Victims Urge Congress to Release DOJ Records Ahead of Key Vote
episodes.description:
Attorney Gloria Allred and alleged Jeffrey Epstein victim Alicia Arden held a press conference on Monday (November 17) urging Congress to release the investigative files on Epstein. "My hope is that finally, these files will be released. And those who were complicit in Jeffrey Epstein's crimes will finally be named, and the American public will get the transparency that they've been promised, and which we all deserve," said Arden. The Republican-controlled U.S. House of Representatives will vote on Tuesday on forcing the release of investigative files on the late sex offender Epstein, with passage seen as all but guaranteed after President Donald Trump dropped his longstanding opposition. Trump's reversal late on Sunday came days after a House petition gathered enough support to force a vote, a rare instance of House Republicans defying the president's wishes. Until the weekend, Trump and his staff had lobbied hard to prevent any further release of files from the criminal investigation by the U.S. Department of Justice into Epstein, a wealthy New York financier who was, for a time, friends with Trump. Democrats, and even some of Trump's supporters, say there is nothing hoax-like in the release of authentic Justice Department records. Epstein was convicted on Florida state and federal charges related to his sexual abuse and trafficking of teenaged girls. He died in a federal jail cell in Manhattan in 2019 in what was ruled a suicide, a few weeks after he was arrested on new federal charges of sex trafficking children. Supporters of the files' release say they also share this concern, and the resolution on which House lawmakers will vote says the Justice Department may withhold or redact the identifying information of victims. If the House passes the resolution, it would move to the Senate, which would also need to vote on it before sending it to Trump to sign. Republican Senate Majority Leader John Thune's office declined to comment on plans for the bill.

---

episodes.title: Prince Andrew Dethroned LIVE: King Charles Strips Prince Andrew of Titles Amid Epstein Scandal
episodes.description:
In a dramatic royal shake-up, King Charles has stripped his brother Prince Andrew of all remaining titles and his residence at Windsor’s Royal Lodge. The move, reportedly backed by the royal family, follows renewed public outrage over Andrew’s links to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Once the Duke of York, Andrew now faces life as a private citizen, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor. Buckingham Palace said the decision reflects the monarchy’s commitment to accountability and compassion for abuse victims. The action marks one of the harshest royal punishments in modern history, further distancing the crown from years of scandal.

episodes.title: Kenya: New Suspected Mass Graves in Shakahola Cult Case | Firstpost Africa | N18G
episodes.description:
Kenyan police have uncovered new suspected mass graves near Shakahola Forest, the site of the world’s deadliest cult massacre. Over the past 10 days, investigators exhumed at least a dozen suspected bodies and collected dozens of human remains from shallow graves in Kwa Binzaro village, close to where more than 450 victims were found in 2023. The Shakahola tragedy was linked to self-proclaimed pastor Paul Mackenzie, who allegedly ordered followers to starve to death to “meet Jesus.” Mackenzie and over 90 associates face terrorism, murder, and child torture charges, while fresh discoveries highlight the enduring horrors of the cult.

episodes.title: LIVE: Russia Jails "Siberian Jesus" for 12 Years for Harming Followers in Bizarre Cult
episodes.description:
A Russian cult leader who claimed to be the reincarnation of Jesus Christ has been sentenced to 12 years in a maximum-security prison. Sergei Torop, known to followers as "Vissarion," founded the Church of the Last Testament in Siberia in 1991 and attracted thousands to his remote commune. Russian authorities say Torop and two aides used psychological manipulation to control followers, causing serious mental and physical harm and defrauding them of money. The court also ordered over $570,000 in compensation to victims. The trio was arrested in a dramatic 2020 raid by Russian security forces. All three denied wrongdoing.

----

episodes.title: Shakahola Massacre: Kenya Cult Leader Paul Mackenzie Pleads Not Guilty for Manslaughter
episodes.description:
Shakahola Massacre: Kenya Cult Leader Paul Mackenzie Pleads Not Guilty for Manslaughter | Firstpost Africa

The hearing resumes in one of the worst cult-related tragedies in the world. Leader of a Kenyan cult, Paul Mackenzie, who allegedly pushed over 400 people to starve to death pleads not guilty in court. Self-proclaimed pastor Paul Mackenzie appeared in court in the coastal city of Mombasa alongside 94 other suspects. Mackenzie was arrested last April after 429 bodies, including children, were dug up from mass graves in Shakahola, a remote forest in eastern Kenya. Mackenzie allegedly told his followers they would get to heaven more quickly if they stopped eating. the incident sent shockwaves in the country and across the world. Watch for more.

---

episodes.title: LIVE: Kenya's "Doomsday Cult" Leader Goes on Trial | Firstpost Africa
episodes.description:
LIVE: Kenya's "Doomsday Cult" Leader Goes on Trial | Firstpost Africa

Welcome to Firstpost Africa with Alyson Le Grange. We are live from Durban, South Africa.

A self-proclaimed pastor Paul Nthenge Mackenzie and almost 100 accomplices have gone on trial in Kenya on terrorism charges over the notorious "Shakahola forest massacre." The case follows the exhumation of more than 400 corpses. Mackenzie, who was arrested in April last year, is alleged to have incited his followers to starve to death to “meet Jesus”. Autopsies carried out on 100 victims determined that the majority had died of starvation, but that some, including children, had been strangled, beaten, or suffocated. Mackenzie and his co-accused all pleaded not guilty to the charges.

Also on the show:
- DR Congo Military Court Sentences 22 Soldiers to Death For "Fleeing the Enemy"
- Ghanaian Chef Ebenezer Smith Fakes Guinness World Records Award, Arrested
- Nigerians Reclaim Their Mangroves Back

---

episodes.title: Kenya Hands Over Bodies of 429 Cult Members, its Head Paul Mackenzie Awaits Trial |Firstpost America
episodes.description:
Kenya Hands Over Bodies of 429 Cult Members, its Head Paul Mackenzie Awaits Trial | Firstpost America

The Kenyan government has begun handing over the remains of the people who were found dead in the Shakahola forest. These people were members of the cult led by Paul Mackenzie and his wife. He convinced these people to starve themselves and their children to death to meet Jesus. The bodies of these people were unearthed by the police who were buried together in groups in mass graves. Some bodies even had internal organs missing. The police arrested Mackenzie in 2023 and charged him with manslaughter, terrorism, and murder. He is currently serving a yearlong jail sentence for illegally running a studio.

---
